page.title: 02** MAYPOLE PROCESSION **
page.content: The procession starts at school. Weeks beforehand people have been hard at work making floats and decorations. They borrow tractors and lorries from nearby farmers. All the local schoolchildren and their parents take part. Each organisation has its own float. The procession follows the main streets of the village before it arrives at Hall Tower field for the afternoon's entertainment. {Stuart Black. Aged 10.Barwick Juniors} On the afternoon of Spring Bank Holliday, two maypoles with ribbons stand at the bottom of the hill. Children from each school dance round them. On a raised stand the queen and her attendants sit. Flowers are given to people who have been invited to do the crowning and speeches are made. {Andrew Maguire. Aged 10. {Barwick Junior School.
